greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Values of j corresponding to least possible k>0 with T(k)-T(j)=n, where T(i)>0 are the triangular numbers A000217.
comment: For k see A138796, for T(k) see A138797 and for T(j) see A138799.
The number of ways n can be written as difference of two triangular numbers is sequence A136107
example: a(30)=3 because 30 = T(30)-T(29)=T(11)-T(8)=T(9)-T(5)=T(8)-T(3) and 3 is the least index of the subtrahends.
results.author: Peter Pein (petsie(AT)dordos.net), Mar 30 2008
